Child.name: stewardship_lifestyle_xp
Child.doc: How many perk points available does the character have?

Child.name: stress
Child.doc: does the character have the required stress?

Child.name: stress_level
Child.doc: does the character have the required stress level?

Child.name: sub_realm_size
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's sub-realm this big (# of counties)?

Child.name: target_is_liege_or_above
Child.doc: is the target character the liege or above the scope character?

Child.name: target_is_same_character_or_above
Child.doc: is the target character the the same character or above (in the vassal hierarchy) the scope character?

Child.name: target_is_vassal_or_below
Child.doc: is the target character a vassal or below of the scope character?

Child.name: target_weight
Child.doc: Target weight of the scoped character

Child.name: tier_difference
Child.doc: What is the difference in highest_held_title_tier between the scoped character and the target character (-5 to 5)

Child.name: time_in_prison
Child.doc: for how long has the character been imprisoned? time_in_prison = { days/months/years =,>,< X }

Child.name: time_in_prison_type
Child.doc: for how long has the character been imprisoned with the current type? time_in_prison_type = { days/months/years =,>,< X }

Child.name: trait_compatibility
Child.doc: target = other character value >/</= sum of trait compatibility values

Child.name: tyranny
Child.doc: does the character have the required tyranny?

Child.name: vassal_contract_has_flag
Child.doc: Do any of the current active obligations in the scoped character's vassal contract have the given flag

Child.name: vassal_contract_has_modifiable_obligations
Child.doc: Can the scoepd character's contract be modified at all, that is: they have one, they use obligation levels, and are count or above

Child.name: vassal_contract_is_blocked_from_modification
Child.doc: Has the scoepd character's contract been blocked from modification by script via 'set_vassal_contract_modification_blocked'

Child.name: vassal_contract_obligation_level_can_be_decreased
Child.doc: Can the obligation level of the scoped character's vassal contract be decreasde?

Child.name: vassal_contract_obligation_level_can_be_increased
Child.doc: Can the obligation level of the scoped character's vassal contract be increased?

Child.name: vassal_count
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's number of vassals (excluding barons) this high?

Child.name: vassal_limit
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's vassal limit this big?

Child.name: vassal_limit_available
Child.doc: Is there this much space left in the character's vassal limit? Negative values also work for checking characters that are above their limit

Child.name: vassal_limit_percentage
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's vassal count this big in comparison to their limit?

Child.name: yearly_character_balance
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's yearly balance this big?

Child.name: yearly_character_expenses
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's yearly expenses this big?

Child.name: yearly_character_income
Child.doc: Is the scoped character's yearly income this big?

Child.name: yields_alliance
Child.doc: Checks if the character would get an alliance with the target character through such a marriage.

Child.name: average_faction_opinion
Child.doc: Average opinion of all the characters of the faction scope target

Child.name: average_faction_opinion_not_powerful_vassal
Child.doc: Average opinion of the character that are NOT powerful vassals of the faction scope target

Child.name: average_faction_opinion_powerful_vassal
Child.doc: Average opinion of the character that are powerful vassals of the faction scope target

Child.name: faction_can_press_demands
Child.doc: Can the scope faction press demands?

Child.name: faction_discontent
Child.doc: Current discontent of the faction

Child.name: faction_is_at_war
Child.doc: Is the scope faction at war?

Child.name: faction_is_type
Child.doc: Is the faction of this type?

Child.name: faction_power
Child.doc: Current power of the faction

Child.name: faction_power_threshold
Child.doc: Current power threshold of the faction

Child.name: has_special_character
Child.doc: Has the faction a special character assigned?

Child.name: has_special_title
Child.doc: Has the faction a special title assigned?

Child.name: number_of_faction_members_in_council
Child.doc: Current number of faction members in faction

Child.name: attacker_war_score
Child.doc: compares the attacker war score

Child.name: days_since_max_war_score
Child.doc: Number of days since the war score has been at max (+100 or -100). Returns -1 if the war score is not +100 or -100

Child.name: defender_war_score
Child.doc: compares the defender war score

Child.name: has_valid_casus_belli
Child.doc: does the war interaction still have a valid casus belli (those should be automatically removed on daily tick, but can exist for a tick)

Child.name: is_attacker
Child.doc: is the target character in the scope war as an attacker?

Child.name: is_civil_war
Child.doc: Check if the scope war is a civil war or not

Child.name: is_defender
Child.doc: is the target character in the scope war as a defender?

Child.name: is_participant
Child.doc: is the target character participating in the scope war as an attacker or defender?

Child.name: is_war_leader
Child.doc: is the target character leading one of the sides in the scope war?

Child.name: is_white_peace_possible
Child.doc: Check if the scoped war's CB has is_white_peace_possible = yes

Child.name: using_cb
Child.doc: is the scope war using the specified CB? using_cb = religious_war

Child.name: war_contribution
Child.doc: Checks how much a character has contributed to the scoped war

Child.name: war_days
Child.doc: compares the number of days the war is going on for

Child.name: was_called
Child.doc: has the target character been called to the scope war already?

Child.name: controls_holy_site
Child.doc: Does the faith control a holy site? controls_holy_site = key_of_holy_site

Child.name: controls_holy_site_with_flag
Child.doc: Does the faith control a holy site with the given flag? controls_holy_site_with_flag = some flag

Child.name: estimated_faith_strength
Child.doc: How strong is the scoped faith? *Expensive*, if you're gonna use the value repeatedly, save it to a scope first! This is scaled by a factor of 1000, so '1' means 1000 men. This is due to the cap of ~2 million, which would be too low in many cases

Child.name: faith_hostility_level
Child.doc: What is the faith's hostility level towards the target faith? faith_hostility_level { target = scope:some_faith value > 1 }

Child.name: faith_hostility_level_comparison
Child.doc: Compares the scoped faith's hostility level towards two other faiths. faith_hostility_level_comparison { faith1 > faith2 }

Child.name: fervor
Child.doc: What is the faith's fervor?

Child.name: has_allowed_gender_for_clergy
Child.doc: Is the target character of the allowed gender to be clergy of the faith?

Child.name: has_doctrine
Child.doc: Does the given faith have the given doctrine?? has_doctrine = doctrine_key

Child.name: has_doctrine_parameter
Child.doc: Does the given faith have the given doctrine parameter? Can only check for bool parameters. has_doctrine_parameter = parameter_key

Child.name: has_dominant_ruling_gender
Child.doc: Is the target character's gender a dominant ruling gender of the faith? Also evaluates to true if there's no dominant ruling gender

Child.name: has_graphical_faith
Child.doc: Does the faith have this graphical faith?

Child.name: has_icon
Child.doc: Does the faith have the given icon

Child.name: has_preferred_gender_for_clergy
Child.doc: Is the target character of the preferred gender to be clergy of the faith?

Child.name: holy_sites_controlled
Child.doc: How many holy sites does the faith control? holy_sites_controlled > 1

Child.name: num_character_followers
Child.doc: Returns how many characters follow the given faith

Child.name: num_county_followers
Child.doc: Returns how many counties follow the given faith

Child.name: religion_tag
Child.doc: checks the tag of the religion of the current faith

Child.name: trait_is_sin
Child.doc: Does the scoped faith consider the given trait a sin?

Child.name: trait_is_virtue
Child.doc: Does the scoped faith consider the given trait a virtue?

Child.name: can_be_exposed_by
Child.doc: can the scope secret be exposed by the target character? can_be_exposed_by = target

Child.name: is_criminal_for
Child.doc: is this secret criminal for the target participant? is_criminal_for = <character>

Child.name: is_known_by
Child.doc: is the scope secret known by the target character?

Child.name: is_shunned_for
Child.doc: is this secret shunned for the target participant? is_shunned_for = <character>

Child.name: is_shunned_or_criminal_for
Child.doc: is this secret shunned or criminal for the target participant? is_shunned_or_illegal_for = <character>

Child.name: is_spent_by
Child.doc: has the scope secret been spent by the target character? is_spent_by = target

Child.name: local_player_knows_this_secret
Child.doc: Does the local player have knowledge about the secret?

Child.name: same_secret_type_as
Child.doc: Is the scope secret of the same type as the target secret?

Child.name: secret_type
Child.doc: Is the scope secret of the specified type?

Child.name: available_loot
Child.doc: How much gold is available to loot for raiding armies?

Child.doc: How many building slots exist (including occupied ones)?

Child.name: combined_building_level
Child.doc: How many levels of normal buildings are there? Duchy and such buildings do not count. Building under construction does not count. The capital building does count

Child.doc: Compares the fort level of a province

Child.name: free_building_slots
Child.doc: How many free building slots exist? A building in construction is considered to be taking a slot

Child.doc: Checks if a province is in a certain geographical region

Child.doc: does the scope province have a particular building?

Child.doc: does the scope province have a particular building or its successor?

Child.doc: does the scope province have a building with a certain flag?

Child.doc: does the scope province have a construction of a building with the specified flag?

Child.name: has_free_building_slot
Child.doc: does the scope province have a free building slot? has_free_building_slot = yes

Child.name: has_holding_type
Child.doc: does the scope province have a holding of particular type?

Child.doc: does the scope province have a construction ongoing?

Child.name: has_province_modifier
Child.doc: Does the scoped province have a given modifier

Child.doc: Does the scoped province have the duration remaining on a given modifier

Child.doc: Does the province (holding) have a special buidling?

Child.doc: Does the province (holding) have a special buidling slot?

Child.doc: is the province a coastal province?

Child.name: is_county_capital
Child.doc: is the province the county capital?

Child.doc: Check the income of the scoped province

Child.doc: How many normal buildings are there? Duchy and such buildings do not count. Building under construction does count

Child.name: number_of_characters_in_pool
Child.doc: Check the number of characters in the pool the scoped province is a part of

Child.name: terrain
Child.doc: Checks if a province is of a specific terrain type

Child.name: num_leased_titles
Child.doc: How many holdings the holy order has under lease

Child.doc: Is the activity activated?

Child.doc: is the target character participating in the scope activity?

Child.doc: the number of activity participants (including the owner)

Child.doc: is this army moving?

Child.doc: what size is this army's max size?

Child.doc: what size is this army?

Child.doc: Is the scoped army in a siege that is relevant to the target character?

Child.doc: Is the scoped army a raid army?

Child.doc: How much raid loot is the army carrying?

Child.doc: The amount of garrison in a county or province from buildings

Child.name: building_levies
Child.doc: The amount of levies in a county or province from buildings

Child.name: squared_distance
Child.doc: How far away is the province/barony/county from the target? Measured in map pixels. Squared for performance reasons (square root is expensive). squared_distance = { target = some province/barony/county value > 10000 }

Child.doc: Saves a temporary target for use during the trigger execution

Child.doc: Checks if the game is in debug mode or not.

Child.doc: Checks whether the specified socope target exists (check for not being the null object)

Child.doc: Compare the date of the bookmarked game launched.

Child.doc: Checks the size of a variable list

Child.doc: Checks whether the current scope has the specified variable list set

Child.doc: Checks if the current map mode is the specified one

Child.doc: Does the game have at least two players currently connected?

Child.doc: Checks whether the current scope has the specified variable set

Child.doc: Checks whether the current scope has the specified variable list set

Child.doc: Checks if a target in in a list

Child.name: is_player_selected
Child.doc: is the player playing a character?

Child.name: is_target_in_global_variable_list
Child.doc: Checks if a target is in a variable list

Child.name: is_target_in_local_variable_list
Child.doc: Checks if a target is in a variable list

Child.doc: Checks if a target is in a variable list

Child.doc: Is the tutorial active?

Child.doc: is the widget with the specified name open?

Child.doc: Checks the size of a list

Child.name: local_variable_list_size
Child.doc: Checks the size of a variable list

Child.name: NAND
Child.doc: a negated AND trigger

Child.name: NOR
Child.doc: a negated OR trigger

Child.name: NOT
Child.doc: negates content of trigger

Child.name: OR
Child.doc: at least one entry inside trigger must be true

Child.name: release_only
Child.doc: Checks if the game is in release mode or not.

Child.name: save_temporary_scope_as
Child.doc: Saves a temporary target for use during the trigger execution

Child.name: save_temporary_scope_value_as
Child.doc: Saves a numerical or bool value as an arbitrarily-named temporary target to be referenced later in the same effect

Child.name: scripted_tests
Child.doc: Checks if the game is currently running scripted tests.

Child.name: switch
Child.doc: Switch on a trigger for the evaluation of another trigger with an optional fallback trigger.

Child.name: time_of_year
Child.doc: Check if the current date is within the bounds

Child.name: trigger_else
Child.doc: Evaluates the triggers if the display_triggers of preceding 'trigger_if' or 'trigger_else_if' is not mettrigger_if = { limit = { <display_triggers> } <triggers> }

Child.name: trigger_else_if
Child.doc: Evaluates the enclosed triggers if the display_triggers of the preceding `trigger_if` or `trigger_else_if` is not met and its own display_trigger of the limit is mettrigger_if = { limit = { <display_triggers> } <triggers> }

Child.name: trigger_if
Child.doc: Evaluates the triggers if the display_triggers of the limit are met

Child.name: variable_list_size
Child.doc: Checks the size of a variable list

Child.name: weighted_calc_true_if
Child.doc: Returns true if the sum of weights of fulfilled sub-triggers amount to the specified sum

Child.doc: How many years it has been since the start of the game

Child.name: in_color_list
Child.doc: Check if the scoped color is part of the given color list

Child.name: is_color
Child.doc: Check if the scoped color is the same as another color. The right hand side can be either a hex, rgb, or hsv color, or a named color, or another color scope.

Child.name: has_maa_of_type
Child.doc: Does this combat side have at least one MaA of the given regiment type? has_maa_of_type = onager

Child.name: is_combat_side_attacker
Child.doc: whether the combat side was the attacker or not

Child.name: is_combat_side_pursuing
Child.doc: is this side the winner of the combat

Child.name: is_combat_side_retreating
Child.doc: is this side defeated in the combat

Child.name: side_soldiers
Child.doc: How many soldiers does this side have still fighting?

Child.name: side_strength
Child.doc: How strong is this side (based on soldiers still fighting)? Scaled down by a factor of 1000 so it doesn't get too large to do math on

Child.name: days_until_ghw_launch
Child.doc: How many days is it until the given GHW launches its war?

Child.name: ghw_attackers_strength
Child.doc: What is the max (if all levies were fully reinforced) military strength of the pledged attackers in the given Great Holy War?

Child.name: ghw_defenders_strength
Child.doc: What is the max (if all levies were fully reinforced) military strength of the pledged defenders in the given Great Holy War?

Child.doc: Is the target character forced to be a defender in the given Great Holy War?

Child.name: has_pledged_attacker
Child.doc: Is the target character pledged as an attacker in the given Great Holy War?

Child.name: has_pledged_defender
Child.doc: Is the target character pledged as a defender in the given Great Holy War?

Child.name: is_directed_ghw
Child.doc: Is the scoped GHW a directed GHW?

Child.name: war_chest_gold
Child.doc: How much gold is in the great holy war's war chest?

Child.name: war_chest_piety
Child.doc: How much piety is in the great holy war's war chest?

Child.name: war_chest_prestige
Child.doc: How much prestige is in the great holy war's war chest?
